widget.name: KeyboardShortcut
widget.description: Allows you to define keyboard shortcuts for buttons on the page.

property.caption: Disabled in Inputs
property.description: When true keys do not trigger when focused in an input.

property.caption: Shortcuts
property.description: These are the key combinations that should the action of the given button.

property.caption: Shortcut
property.description: This is the keyboard shortcut that should be caught. Examples include alt+s and ctrl+alt+shift+f1. For modifier keys you can use shift, ctrl, alt, option, meta, command, and mod (either ctrl or command depending on platform). Other special keys are backspace, tab, enter, return, capslock, esc, escape, space, pageup, pagedown, end, home, left, up, right, down, ins, and del. Any other key you should be able to reference by name like a, /, $, *, or =.

property.caption: Button Class
property.description: Enter the CSS class of the button to be fired here.
